author: sambitsargam2003
title: Chatting Dapp using Blockchain
description: In this era of ubiquitous messaging applications, users are becoming increasingly aware of the data privacy issues associated with such apps

f6_assessments.q0: Unfortunately, this proposal is extremely superficial and none of the parameters to evaluate it positively are respected. Despite this, the idea behind is actual and interesting, creating social networks able to maintain privacy and control over our data by exploiting blockchain technology is an excellent starting point, but it should be developed much better, no details are provided on the Dapp that is vaguely described.
f6_assessments.q1: It seems to me extremely unlikely that this product will be realized and become commonly used in the Cardano ecosystem, also because it is only vaguely mentioned what it should look like.
f6_assessments.q2: As for the rest of the proposal, the aspects to audit the progress and the success are insufficient and irrelevant, failing to deal intermediate steps and parameters to assess the success of the final product.

f6_assessments.q0: Aim of the proposal is to develop a blockchain technology system that will be more secure and efficient, and easy to implement, but there is no detailed description about  how that system will look like, how to develop it, or how the system will address the challenge. There is absolutely no evidence to show how the proposal will make impact on the community,
f6_assessments.q1: Proposer says the plan will last 6 months but does not provide any timeline, no scope, no marketing strategy to attract users, no personal information as well. The budget is broken down into 3 parts: making, testing, other. But what specifically is "other"?
f6_assessments.q2: There is no specific method for the community to track progress. There is no schedule, no scope, or measurable metrics in place. There isn't anything that would allow for a progress audit.

f6_assessments.q0: The problem identified makes sense and is of great importance. It is important to point out that the use of dapps to exchange messages privately, such as Signal and Status, have little user traction so a necessary point to be addressed is a plan to solve this problem as well. The proposal is a draft and there is no information to identify the potential impact of this proposal on the challenge. I would recommend that the proposer use the following documentation (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1oE_cnP0gksdAanXV4w5DYaDNp_tbYEvyHhTUG4HYZ3Q/edit? disco=AAAAG42-Ypk&usp_dm=true) as a reference to design the new proposal, including elements that help in the indication of impact.

f6_assessments.q0: The goal of this proposal seems to be to create blockchain technology for messaging applications to provide more secure and efficient systems, privacy, data security, and ease of deployment. This proposal may be related, but its challenge association cannot be assessed. Also, the proposal appears to be just an idea, or a "call to action" as mentioned, and not really a proposal. So even if the idea is good and can be successfully implemented, we cannot know how it will be implemented. The proponent should be more explicit about how the project will bring value to the Cardano ecosystem and how it is sustainable or how it can grow in the future, once funded and after the funding is used . In addition, the challenges and risks that may be encountered during project implementation are described very briefly, what are the risks in Dapp testing and what is your solution.
f6_assessments.q1: Since much information is missing, it is impossible to know if the project is viable. The proposal is only briefly explained, without much information so that the community can track the progress of the project. Without a plan and roadmap, it is impossible to match an investment background with the relevant experience required to implement the solution. There is no description of the group, what I know here is that the author will do the work alone, but relevant information about the author such as experience, name, qualifications or any links to Author profiles are not provided. This is also important for the budget of the proposal, although the proposal requires a very modest budget of only $1000, it should be broken down and explained better. Besides the information already mentioned, it would be good to discuss the technical aspect of implementing such a solution based on blockchain, and it would be good to include information about who will develop it. In addition, some challenges such as adoption, access to digital platforms and other related aspects can be discussed.
f6_assessments.q2: As pointed out, the probability of evaluating the proposal is low, as it does not show a roadmap with a development plan, detailed explanation of each step, milestones and delivery of each part, timeline, and several ways for the community to measure the success of the proposal, such as metrics and KPIs. In this case, the KPI could be the number of users of your website. In addition, some deadlines and milestones need to be outlined, and some of the risks involved in implementing the plan should also be discussed. This is a brand new proposal so the proponent probably has no experience in presenting. Because your idea is good but the proposal writing is poor, I suggest you rewrite the proposal according to the Catalyst documentation with more content.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal consists of a decentralized application so it fits the challenge. Likewise, I am not going to give a maximum score here since it is not described how this application will be carried out.
f6_assessments.q1: The truth is that a proposal like this seems to me to be disrespectful towards the rest of the proponents. Nothing is specified about the plan, nor is any explanation made as to why he, as the sole proponent, will be able to carry out the proposal. You have to take this seriously and make a proposal with quality content and complete and detailed explanations.
f6_assessments.q2: Seeing the general proposal, I did not expect anything in this section. It does not mention any metric to be able to measure progress and it does not explain in depth what success is for the proposal.

solution: Blockchain technology provides more secure and efficient, privacy, data security, and easy to implement systems.
